lead_paragraph: Dirk Nowitzki had 35 points and 11 rebounds in Germany’s 83-78 overtime victory against the Czech Republic on the opening day of the European championships in Madrid. Pau Gasol scored 19 points as host Spain routed Portugal, 82-56, in Seville to begin its campaign to become the third country to win the European trophy while holding the world title. Greece, the defending champion, opened with a 76-66 win over Israel in Granada.
